titleByLocale.en: Let's make a Top-Down RPG game

bulletPointsByLocale.en: Use a behavior to control a top-down character.
Use another behavior for the pixel perfect movement .

messageByLocale.en:
This game is for that classic pixel perfect rpg style movement system, the game have ready some camera boundaries and an end screen when the player walks in to the house. Let's see the current game state.

Click on the **preview** button to play.

The player cannot move yet, the behavior Top-down movement is missing on the **$(player)** object.

Let's add it.
Let's update the max speed to **100**, so the player can move faster.
Uncheck this case, so the player can move only on x and y axis.
Uncheck this case, this way the player wont rotate to the direction you're moving to.

Let's add movement to our player with the help of a **behavior**.

Click on the 3 dot menu, or right click on **$(player)**, and select **Edit behaviors**.

Let's add movement to our player with the help of a **behavior**.

Select, then long press on **$(player)**, then select **Edit behaviors**.
That's it! Now the player can move on both axis, like in Pokemon!

If you are previewing the game now the player can move on two axis.

But the player movement isn't pixel perfect yet.
Let's add a new behavior for this use to the **$(player)**.

Open this object to be able to add the Pixel perfect top-down movement **behavior** on it.

Click on the 3 dot menu, or right click on **$(player)**, and select **Edit behaviors**.

Open this object to be able to add the Pixel perfect top-down movement **behavior** on it.

Select, then long press on **$(player)**, then select **Edit behaviors**.
That's it! Now the player can move and be aligned with the pixel grid and all other pixel art elements of the game.

We're done!
Let's test our game to see the changes we've made!

Click on the **Preview** button.
